original_text: We prove the uniqueness of the supersymmetric Salam–Sezgin (Minkowski)4×S2 ground state among all non-singular solutions with a four-dimensional Poincaré, de Sitter or anti-de Sitter symmetry. We construct the most general solutions with an axial symmetry in the two-dimensional internal space, and show that included amongst these is a family that is non-singular away from a conical defect at one pole of a distorted 2-sphere. These solutions admit the interpretation of 3-branes with negative tension.
original_translation: Demostramos la unicidad del estado base supersimétrico de Salam-Sezgin (Minkowski)4×S2 entre todas las soluciones no singulares con simetría de Poincaré, de Sitter o anti-de Sitter en cuatro dimensiones. Construimos las soluciones más generales con simetría axial en el espacio interno bidimensional, y mostramos que entre ellas se incluye una familia que no es singular lejos de un defecto cónico en un polo de una esfera 2 distorsionada. Estas soluciones admiten la interpretación de 3-branas con tensión negativa.
original_sentences: We prove the uniqueness of the supersymmetric Salam–Sezgin (Minkowski)4×S2 ground state among all non-singular solutions with a four-dimensional Poincaré, de Sitter or anti-de Sitter symmetry.

We construct the most general solutions with an axial symmetry in the two-dimensional internal space, and show that included amongst these is a family that is non-singular away from a conical defect at one pole of a distorted 2-sphere.
These solutions admit the interpretation of 3-branes with negative tension.
